name: Grevy's Zebra
description: The largest of all zebras, it differs from others with its dense, narrow striping and rounded ear flaps.
spread_note: Fragmented parts of Ethiopia and Kenya
image_alt: Grevy's Zebra, photo: Tereza Mrhálková, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length 2.5–3 m, tail length 40–75 cm, shoulder height 1.4–1.6 cm, weight 350–450 kg
reproduction: The female is pregnant for 390–400 days and gives birth to 1 foal.
attractions: Grevy’s Zebras form small groups led by a dominant stallion, which guards its territory and females from rivals.
projects_note: Grevy’s Zebra is one of the most endangered large African mammals, listed as endangered on the IUCN Red List.
breeding: Grevy’s Zebras were kept in Prague Zoo from 1953–1961 and again since 1972.
